name: 魏敏樺
objective: 基礎為結構物與建築物之下部結構，其安全與整個結構物、建築物之安全息息相關，故基礎設計必須特別慎重。本課程宜包括下列各項：(1)基礎之種類及其選擇、(2)基礎之承載力計算、(3)基礎之沈陷分析、(4)各種基腳及筏基之設計、(5)深基(樁基、墩基、沈箱基礎)之設計。
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction
Week 2: Site Exploration and Characterization
Week 3-4: Soil Behaviour 
Triaxial test: apparatus, interpretation, test types
Stress and strain parameters
Behaviour of Sands
Behaviour of Clays
Soil models
Week 5-8: Shallow foundations
General
Modes of failure 
Types of foundations
Capacity under general loading 
The structural design of shallow foundation
Week 9: Midterm Exam
Week 10-12: Piled foundations
Types of displacement piles
Types of replacement piles
Axial and lateral capacity of piles
Group effect
Raking piles to resist lateral loads
Testing of piles
Week 13-15: Retaining Walls
Wall types
Methods of analysis: Rankine’s method, limit equilibrium method
Factor of Safety
Analysis of Gravity walls, Sheet pile walls
Week 16: Settlement of Foundations
Week 17: Special cases
Foundations in special conditions
Foundations for machinery
Pier and Caisson 
Week 18: Final Exam
materials:
1.　　Atkinson J. (1993) An introduction to the Mechanics of Soils and foundations through Critical State Soil Mechanics, McGraw-Hill
2.　　Bowles J.E. (1975) Foundation analysis and design, McGraw-Hill
3.　　Coduto D.P. (2001) Foundation design: Principles and Practices, Prentice Hall, New Jersey
4.　　Craig R.F. (2004) Soil Mechanics (7th ed.), Spon Press (New York)
5.　　Mitchell J.K. and Soga, K. (2001) Fundamentals of Soil Behaviour (2nd ed.) John Wiley & Sons Ltd
6.　　Parry R.H.G. (1995) Mohr Circles, Stress Paths and Geotechnics: The Conservation Approach to Treatment, Spons Architecture Price Book, 03/1995, 256 pages
